item.title: Overview
item.description: Y/ZWallet supports one or many accounts. Each account has a shielded and transparent address (unless it was restored from a secret key). An address has zero or more notes. For shielded accounts, notes are encrypted and only visible to the account owner. Transparent addresses have notes in cleartext. A note is conceptually an “I Owe You”. It can have any amount greater than zero (including zero). The account balance is the sum of all the note amounts.

item.title: Account Manager
item.description: Open the account manager by selecting “Accounts” in the app menu. Name Total Balance Shielded Balance Transparent Balance Long Press to Edit Name Swipe left/right to Delete Add/Restore Account To return to the account page, select an account by tapping on its name. Or press the back button, if you don’t want to change the current selection. Remarks There needs to be at least one account. The last account cannot be deleted

item.title: Backup Restore
item.description: Backup Backups are very important and must be taken unless you don’t mind losing access to the account and the coins it contains. Fortunately, it is very easy to make a backup. The account backup is the 24 words (in sequence) displayed on the Backup page (seed phrase) When you create a new account, the app will show you the Backup page automatically. If you need to recall that page, open the app menu and select “Backup”.

item.title: Notes
item.description: The Note Tab shows your received notes. Display and Sorting Tap to toggle the display of Height or Number of Confirmations Tap to sort by Date/Time (switches between ascending, descending, and unsorted) Tap to sort by Amount Larger notes appear in bolder typeface Status Notes spent in unconfirmed transactions are crossed out Notes that don’t have enough confirmations (3 by default) are dimmed Navigation Current Page Go to First Page Previous Page Next Page Go to Last Page Adjust the Number of rows per page.

item.title: Payment URI
item.description: The Receive/Payment URI page is for making QR codes that encode your receiving address (shielded or transparent) an amount requested in coins or in fiat currency and a memo text Once you fill these fields, tap the “Make QR” button to update the QR code. If you don’t tap the button, the QR code is just your receiving address. You can also tap the QR code to refresh it.

item.title: Transactions
item.description: The History Tab shows the transaction history. Tap to toggle the display of height / confirmations Tap to sort by Date/Time (switches between ascending, descending, and unsorted) Tap to sort by Amount Tap to sort by Transaction ID Current page range Go to First Page Previous Page Next Page Go to Last Page Adjust the Number of rows per page. You may have to scroll the footer to the left if your screen is too small.

item.title: Synchronization
item.description: The app keeps up to date with the blockchain automatically. It checks the current status of the blockchain every 15s. Rescan You can manually trigger a rescan. Either from the first block, or from a given date (1). Scan Progress Status Current block height being processed Latest block height The Estimated remaining time of the full scan When the app is synchronized with the current block, it just displays the block height.
